body: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SprmagaPmmkzwFPvvYNII2baCkEzRp3kYpdHF5IGr*1Gy3BFaazDWZoBAczv4xcWxq7MYZ*QxIBQSG-BFBOtvxAYDJ11sxuH/Adjacencieserror.JPG) hello everyone, If anyone can tell why am I am getting gaps in my floor and roof - would highly appreciate it. I have attached the definition, it's a little hectic but I am going with it one level and one piece at a time. Also checked: the missing floors are seen as ground floor and the missing roofs are seen as ceilings - so how do I properly change this?  Any suggestions are welcomed.

replies.body:
Haven't checked your model but from your comments.



1. The floor surfaces should show as ground floor in case the z value of all the points is 0.

2. Are you having other zones on top of these zones? A roof changes to ceiling if the boundary condition is another surface and not outdoors

Not at the moment - in a later stage I will have others on top. The thing is I create the zones from breps and I think I need to explode them and define each surface - which I was really looking forward to avoid. 

As i said I am working on the ground floor before i go up. 



On this subject - is there a tutorial or a file on how to make an atrium?

The thing is I create the zones from breps and I think I need to explode them and define each surface - which I was really looking forward to avoid. 



Just make sure the Breps are modeled correctly. Check all of them to be at the same level and the surfaces are touching.

On this subject - is there a tutorial or a file on how to make an atrium?

I can't remember of any but it is quite similar to creating zones next to each other except that you will have more interior windows.
Cool - Thank you so much for your support.
